title: Six-month-old baby's finger chopped during discharge at private hospital in Bengaluru
content: The Indiranagar police registered an FIR charging the nurse, doctor and  hospital management under Section 125(b) (acts that endanger human life or personal safety through rash or negligent behaviour) of BNS

title: DGCA also at fault as it admits non-compliance in VSR Ventures: Rohit Pawar
content: Rohit Pawar said the report issued by the DGCA had stated that during the last regulatory audit conducted in February 2025, no "Level-I findings" were reported against VSR Ventures

title: Newly-wed Dalit couple denied entry to temple in Karnataka, officials convene peace meeting in village
content: After the peace meeting, the district administration comprising police and revenue officials escorted the newly-wed couple to perform puja

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly election: CPI (M) leader Shanmugam casts doubt on AIADMK’s role in NDA seat-sharing
content: Some parties in the NDA had indicated that they would hold seat sharing talks only with the BJP, which the national party had not denied, said P. Shanmugam.

title: Pinarayi govt in Kerala ‘itself a brand in PR exercise’, slams Ernakulam-Angamaly Archdiocese mouthpiece
content: In a hard-hitting editorial in Sathyadeepam, the archdiocese calls Kerala government out on a range of issues, including launch of a new brand of liquor, alleged data breach and spending on publicity campaigns

title: BJP hits back at Priyanka Gandhi with 'female Ghajini' barb over Gaza remarks
content: “You might carry the fake Gandhi surname, but you clearly lack the conviction and the courage. #SelectiveOutrage,” Mr. Bhatia said

title: Supreme Court stays trial in ED case against Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren
content: In his plea before the top court, Mr. Soren had also challenged the repetitive summons issued to him by the ED. Mr. Soren has challenged the recent Jharkhand High Court's decision refusing to quash the case against him

title: Supreme Court refuses to ban movie title ‘Yadav Ji ki Love Story’, says it does not portray caste in bad light
content: During the hearing, the counsel for the petitioner argued that while they do not oppose inter-community marriages, the film’s portrayal of a woman was unacceptable

title: Supreme Court junks plea challenging validity of BNSS provisions on appointment of prosecution officers
content: "The challenge arises on the ground that the impugned provisions, though purportedly enacted to strengthen prosecution machinery, in effect subvert judicial independence by inducting members of judiciary into executive-controlled prosecutorial posts, thereby impermissibly merging judicial and executive functions," says the plea

title: Minister inspects unit that produces drinking water from air in school in Karnataka
content: The unit collects moisture from the atmosphere, condenses it, and purifies it to make potable water. The technology can produce water throughout the year without depending on groundwater or rainfall

title: Two children among four hospitalised after stray dog bite in Chennai
content: Police said the residents in Nagathamman Koil Street of Sanjay Gandhi Colony have been complaining about stray dog menace in the locality in recent times

title: Rahul on ‘compromised mission’, has links with ‘pro-Pak elements’: Nitin Nabin
content: BJP chief Nitin Nabin charged Rahul Gandhi, the Leader of Opposition, with being on a “compromised mission” that began with his great grandfather and first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru and “continued through generations”

title: BMC Budget LIVE: BMC presents Budget, earmarks total outlay of ₹80,952.56 crore
content: All eyes on the Budget since this is the first time in four years, after the elections, it is being presented

title: House of J&K Deputy CM’s brother raided by ACB, ‘targeted due to rivalry within police’
content: “I was not expecting that an officer who fought against terrorism and criminals would face such an action,” says Deputy Chief Minister Surinder Choudhary

title: Madhyamik admit card can be submitted along with pass certificate, SC clarifies in West Bengal SIR
content: The court also directed that verification documents which have not been uploaded so far, and received before February 14, should be submitted by EROs/AEROs by 5 p.m. on February 26, 2026

title: Indian Navy to commission ‘Dolphin Hunter’ INS Anjadip in Chennai
content: This is the third of eight vessels being built under the anti-submarine warfare shallow water craft project

title: Highly condemnable, shameful: Priyanka slams arrest of IYC leaders
content: She asserted that it is in the interest of 1.4 billion Indians to raise voice against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the government which has "compromised" India's interests by bowing to global pressure

title: India's support measures in auto, renewable energy sectors fully compliant with WTO norms: Official
content: Following a request by China, the WTO dispute settlement body announced the setting up of a panel to hear the case

title: Ramesh Chennithala releases official letter on alleged SPARK data leak, questions Kerala CM’s role
content: Senior Congress leader accuses Kerala Chief Minister’s Office of orchestrating a massive collection of personal data from government employees, calling it a ‘blatant case of data theft’

title: CJI eyes suo motu case over NCERT’s Class 8 textbook chapter alleging ‘corruption in judiciary’
content: “Bar and Bench are both perturbed. All the High Court judges are perturbed. I have received many calls,” says CJI Surya Kant

title: 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots case: Court acquits 37 accused for lack of evidence
content: Additional District and Sessions Judge Manjula Bhalotiya acquitted 37 accused, observing that the prosecution failed to prove the charges beyond reasonable doubt

title: Haryana authorities nab four people in ₹590-crore IDFC First Bank case
content: Of the four arrested, two are ex-IDFC First Bank employees and two are private persons who own a partnership firm

title: Modi displaying 'moral cowardice' when world is critical of Netanyahu: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in charge of communications, Jairam Ramesh, said Prime Minister Modi is "brazenly embracing" his Israeli counterpart, who has reduced Gaza to rubble and dust and who is orchestrating the expansion of illegal settlements in the occupied West Bank

title: Harness technology with ethics and adaptability, Professor L.M. Patnaik tells graduates at Gulbarga University convocation
content: Artificial Intelligence, he observed, holds great promise for the future, but concerns remain about its impact on jobs and education, bias, lack of ethics and moral sense, and its inability to explain decisions

title: Doctors stress early treatment, dispel myths about bone cancer
content: Doctors say, among other things, amputation is no longer necessary in the vast majority of bone cancer cases

title: 'Dinbandhu shot me': 18-year-old bride shot on wedding stage in Bihar
content: An 18-year-old bride was shot during her varmala ceremony in Buxar district by a masked assailant. The victim, Aarti Kumari, identified her alleged attacker as a neighbor with whom she had a one-sided relationship. She is currently on a ventilator in critical condition in Varanasi.

title: 'We are ashamed': Harsh Singh apologises over racial slurs at 3 Arunachal women in Delhi
content: Harsh Singh apologized after allegations of racial slurs and intimidation against three women from Arunachal Pradesh. The incident, stemming from a dispute over repair work, led to Singh's wife Ruby Jain's arrest. Singh expressed shame and requested a fair investigation, stating the confrontation occurred in the heat of the moment.

title: Terrifying highway crash Maharashtra: Car carrying liquor flips several times, driver dies
content: A car accident on the Dhule-Surat highway tragically claimed the life of a 29-year-old driver. The vehicle overturned multiple times, leaving his companion critically injured. Authorities discovered several boxes of country-made liquor inside the car without proper permits. Legal action was initiated against the driver for rash and dangerous driving, with further charges pending following his death.

title: Assam woman dragged out of car, gang-raped in front of fiance
content: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped on the Ramnagar bypass road in Silchar after her fiancé was restrained by a group of youths. The incident occurred on February 19, with police registering a case under multiple sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita. One accused has been arrested, and efforts are underway to apprehend others.

title: Ranji final explodes: J&K captain Paras Dogra headbutts Karnataka fielder — watch
content: Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra headbutted a Karnataka substitute fielder during the Ranji Trophy final, sparking heated exchanges. Despite the incident and subsequent confrontations, Jammu and Kashmir continued to dominate, building on a strong first innings performance.

title: Apple, Nvidia, Qualcomm and AMD ignore US ‘China warning’ threatening economy
content: US officials have repeatedly warned tech giants like Apple and Nvidia about the severe economic risks of relying heavily on Taiwan for advanced computer chips. Concerns over potential Chinese action against Taiwan could cripple the US tech sector. Despite incentives and threats, shifting supply chains proves slow, with new domestic production facing significant hurdles.

title: Former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren's grandson dies under mysterious circumstances
content: Veer Soren, grandson of former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren, died in Manali under mysterious circumstances. He was found unconscious with foam around his mouth by friends at their homestay. Doctors declared him dead after attempts to revive him failed. High altitude sickness is a suspected cause pending the postmortem report.

title: 'How did that go for them?' Trump taunts Russian, Chinese defences in Venezuela
content: US forces, in a swift operation, captured Venezuelan President Maduro and his wife, showcasing American military might. President Trump highlighted the failure of Russian and Chinese defense technology to prevent the capture, asserting a significant victory for US security and a new dawn for Venezuela. The operation involved advanced US capabilities, overwhelming Venezuelan defenses.

title: ‘Who’s your best XI?’: Ricky Ponting warns India to return to ‘basics’ or risk T20 World Cup exit
content: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting urged India to abandon overthinking match-ups and select their best XI to revive their T20 World Cup campaign. Following a significant defeat, Ponting emphasised prioritising team balance and experience, advocating for the return of Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel to bolster bowling options.

title: Sam Altman at IIT-Delhi: 'Traditional career advice won’t work in the AI era'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, urging a balanced perspective on AI's impact and encouraging calculated risk-taking for future success.

title: What's happening in the IDFC First Bank Rs 590 crore scam case? Top developments
content: Haryana's State Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau has arrested four individuals, including two former IDFC First Bank employees and two private partners, in connection with a Rs 590 crore fraud. The bank disclosed the fraud involving its employees and external parties in accounts linked to the Haryana government.

title: Gold price prediction: Will gold, silver be able to hold on to gains this week?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are moving up but the lack of any major positive catalyst may limit the upside this week, says Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers.

title: 1 hour, 48 minutes: Trump overtakes Bill Clinton to deliver longest speech
content: US President Donald Trump delivered the longest State of the Union address on record, clocking in at nearly 1 hour and 48 minutes.  He highlighted his immigration policies and defended tariffs, drawing mixed reactions from lawmakers.  This lengthy speech continues a trend of modern presidents delivering more extended addresses compared to earlier eras.

title: After JPMorgan’s shares 'crash', CEO Jamie Dimon calls AI fears overblown
content: JPMorgan Chase shares dipped amid fears of AI disrupting payment systems, with American Express and Mastercard also seeing declines. However, CEO Jamie Dimon dismissed these concerns, viewing AI as an opportunity. Separately, JPMorgan accused Donald Trump of fraudulently naming Dimon in a $5 billion lawsuit to keep the case in Florida, arguing the claims lack merit.

title: Delhi court directs cricketer Shikhar Dhawan’s ex-wife to return Rs 5.7cr
content: An Indian court has ruled that Australian family court orders regarding property settlements are unenforceable in India. The judge stated that the concept of "property settlement" under Australian law is alien to Indian matrimonial law. Consequently, Shikhar Dhawan's former wife was ordered to return Rs 5.7 crore and cannot claim Rs 16.9 crore awarded by the Australian court.

title: Thar falls into 100-feet-deep ravine while performing 'stunts' in Faridabad; Class 9 student dies
content: A 15-year-old boy died and two others were critically injured when a Mahindra Thar plunged into a 100-feet-deep ravine in Faridabad. The incident occurred as the driver allegedly performed stunts on a dirt track. Passersby rescued the victims, but the 15-year-old was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Noel Tata lists out criteria on which Chandra must deliver
content: Tata Sons' board is re-evaluating Chairman Chandrasekaran's reappointment, with Noel Tata outlining performance criteria.  Concerns over losses in aviation and digital, capital expenditure in new ventures, and maintaining the unlisted status are key.  This comes after significant group setbacks and a market cap decline, prompting a closer look at leadership continuity.

title: Delhi to be renamed Indraprastha? BJP MP writes to Amit Shah after Kerala's name change
content: A BJP MP has proposed renaming Delhi to Indraprastha. He believes this name connects the capital to its ancient past. The MP cited historical evidence linking Delhi to the Mahabharata. He also suggested renaming key transport hubs. This move aims to reconnect with India's roots and foster cultural revival. The proposal follows the recent approval to rename Kerala as Keralam.

title: 'Laughed at by his village': Journey of 'Pad Man' who changed millions of women’s lives
content: A school dropout, Arunachalam Muruganantham, revolutionized menstrual hygiene in India by inventing an affordable sanitary pad-making machine. Driven by concern for his wife's struggles, he overcame ridicule and social isolation to create a decentralized system empowering women. His innovation not only provides access to hygiene but also fosters economic independence and breaks down societal taboos.

title: ‘Shake-up call’: Shastri warns India must act fast to save semi-final hopes
content: India face a crucial Super 8 clash against Zimbabwe after a significant loss to South Africa. Former coach Ravi Shastri believes this setback could be the wake-up call the team needs. India must win to avoid elimination. Shastri emphasises strengthening bowling with Axar Patel's return. The team's semi-final hopes now depend on a swift and effective response to this challenge.

title: 'Pak PM would have died if ... ': Donald Trump misspeaks - what he meant
content: US President Donald Trump claimed during his State of the Union address that his intervention prevented a nuclear war between India and Pakistan, stating the Pakistan Prime Minister would have died without his involvement. He cited praise from the Pakistani PM for saving "35 million" lives. However, India has rejected any third-party mediation in de-escalating tensions during Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Welcome, Modi': Jerusalem Post front page features PM as he embarks on 2-day Israel visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi graces the front page of The Jerusalem Post ahead of his historic visit to Israel.  The newspaper highlights the burgeoning India-Israel partnership and Modi's upcoming address to the Knesset, marking a significant milestone.  Discussions will focus on deepening bilateral ties across various sectors, including technology, defense, and economy.

title: Dalilah's Law: Trump seeks license ban for illegal immigrants after Indian-origin driver case
content: US President Trump has proposed "Dalilah's Law," aiming to prevent states from granting driver's licenses to undocumented immigrants. The legislation is named after Dalilah Coleman, a young girl severely injured in a crash allegedly caused by an undocumented truck driver. Trump also advocated for stricter criminal justice reforms, emphasizing keeping repeat offenders incarcerated.

title: T20 WC semi-finals qualification scenario: What India must do to stay alive
content: India face a virtual knockout phase in the T20 World Cup after a significant loss to South Africa, severely impacting their net run rate. They must now win their remaining matches convincingly against Zimbabwe and West Indies, while also hoping for favorable results in other games to secure a semi-final spot.

title: 'Bad policy, but nice guy': Donald Trump on NYC mayor Zohran Mamdani
content: During his State of the Union address, US President Trump unexpectedly mentioned New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani, calling him a "nice guy" despite ideological differences. Trump used Mamdani as an example to advocate for stricter voter ID laws, contrasting the requirements for a snow-shoveling job with those for voting.

title: Blueprint for revival: How India can reignite their T20 World Cup campaign
content: Following a significant defeat to South Africa, India faces calls for tactical adjustments. Key recommendations include diversifying the left-heavy top order, recalling all-rounder Axar Patel for control, and refining the Powerplay batting approach. Rethinking Hardik Pandya's bowling role and adopting a focused mindset are also crucial for recovery.

title: Fresh details emerge in Jharkhand air crash probe; no Mayday call sent
content: An air ambulance en route from Ranchi to Delhi disappeared from radar shortly after departure, after the pilot requested a lower cruising height amid deteriorating weather conditions. Authorities say there was no distress call before contact was lost.

title: Bhopal man dies after speeding Thar rams car in Goa
content: A 65-year-old tourist from Bhopal died after his car was hit by a speeding SUV at the Happy Bar junction in Assagao. Eyewitnesses allege occupants of the rented SUV attempted to switch seats after the collision. Police are investigating the incident, verifying claims of a driver cover-up.

title: 'Black people aren't apes!' US lawmaker escorted out for protest during Trump's speech
content: During President Trump's State of the Union, Democratic Rep. Al Green was removed from the House chamber for holding a sign stating 'Black people aren’t apes!' This protest referenced a racist video of the Obamas on Trump's social media. Green aimed for Trump to see the message, asserting Black people are not apes.

title: 'Tariffs will replace income tax': Trump defends trade deals after Supreme Court ruling
content: President Trump asserted that most trading partners wish to maintain existing trade deals despite a Supreme Court ruling invalidating some tariffs. He also suggested tariff revenue could eventually replace income taxes, claiming these duties fueled economic growth and generated billions. However, a New York Fed paper indicated US firms and consumers bore most tariff costs.

title: Emotion, devotees surge at Bhojshala as ASI report fuels demand for temple
content: An Archaeological Survey of India report, submitted to the MP High Court, concludes the Kamal Maula Mosque at Bhojshala was built using parts of ancient temples. Scientific investigations reveal the structure, dating back to the Paramara dynasty, incorporates dismantled temple remains. The court has directed parties to file objections on the findings.

title: 16-year-old girl holds father’s legs as elder sister slits his throat in UP
content: Two sisters in Muzaffarnagar allegedly murdered their father after enduring years of discrimination and taunts. The daughters, aged 16 and 32, drugged their family before the elder sister slit their sleeping father's throat. Police detained the sisters, who confessed to the crime, citing his differential treatment and constant criticism.

title: Talk on Kashmir incident sparks protest at Azim Premji University in Bengaluru
content: Tension erupted at Azim Premji University as ABVP activists protested a scheduled discussion on alleged state violence in Kashmir. Police took around 25 activists into custody. The university clarified no event was authorized or held on campus, condemning the disruption. AISA accused ABVP of stifling academic debate.

title: 'Will consolidate ties': PM Modi leaves for Israel — What’s on agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Israel aims to further consolidate the strong bond and strategic partnership between the two nations. Discussions with Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu will focus on strengthening cooperation across various domains, including defense, trade, technology, and economic ties, while also addressing regional developments.

title: Turnaround time: India eye reboot vs Zimbabwe after heavy loss to South Africa
content: Following a significant loss to South Africa, Team India faces Zimbabwe in a must-win match at Chepauk, needing a strong performance to boost morale and improve their net run rate. With key batters struggling, India hope for a dominant win while acknowledging external factors and Zimbabwe's inexperience in Indian conditions.

title: 'Drill, baby, drill': Trump hails US oil boost, calls Venezuela 'new friend and partner'
content: President Trump touted record-high American natural gas and oil production, attributing it to his "drill, baby, drill" policy. He also highlighted a significant oil import from Venezuela, calling the nation a "friend and partner."  Despite claims of falling gas prices, AAA data indicated higher averages than stated.

title: ‘Doomsday president’: Who is Donald Trump's 'designated survivor' Mike Thompson?
content: During President Trump's State of the Union, Congressman Mike Thompson served as the designated survivor, a security measure ensuring government continuity. This role, though less dramatic than fiction suggests, requires constitutional eligibility and focuses the mind on potential catastrophic events. The practice, originating during the Cold War, ensures a successor is available if disaster strikes.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with investigative series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirk’s allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: NBA trade rumor: Lakers eye $131M Cavaliers superstar in major deal
content: Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly eyeing Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen before the 2026 trade deadline. The proposed deal involves sending Austin Reaves and future draft picks to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster the Lakers' frontcourt with much-needed size and defense, while the Cavaliers could gain scoring and guard play.

title: Over 2,700 tourists rescued after heavy snowfall blocks road to Tsomgo Lake in Sikkim
content: Heavy snowfall in the higher reaches of Sherathang and adjoining areas led to road blockages, leaving 541 tourist vehicles stranded between 15th Mile and Tsomgo Lake, says officials

title: ‘Kannada must receive highest recognition in Karnataka,’ says Professor Marulasiddappa at Kannada University convocation
content: While acknowledging that no one could object to learning English as a language, he cautioned against promoting English as the medium of instruction at the cost of regional languages

title: Kochi Metro services disrupted for an hour after train breaks down
content: Services disrupted after train developed technical issue in brake system at MG Road station around 8 a.m. Spare train arrived from metro’s coach-maintenance depot and towed stranded one for repair works

title: Hope PM Modi mentions genocide in Gaza while addressing Knesset: Priyanka
content: The Congress on February 24 alleged that the government has abandoned the Palestinians and said the Prime Minister was going to Israel despite that country’s attacks on civilians in Gaza continue “mercilessly”

title: PM Modi departs for Israel, to become first Indian PM to address Knesset | LIVE
content: Israel’s Opposition has said it would boycott PM Modi’s address to the Israeli Parliament if President of the Supreme Court of Israel, Yitzhak Amit, is not invited as per protocol.

title: British architect Sir Edwin Lutyens and his Madras connection
content: With Sir Edwin Lutyens’ bust removed from the Rashtrapati Bhavan he designed, here’s a look at his links to Madras

title: Dolphin City: Chennai’s dolphinarium that shaped national debate on marine mammal captivity over 25 years ago
content: Hosting a dolphinarium in Chennai turned into controversy as all the three dolphins died, setting off one of the country’s earliest debates on the ethics of marine mammal captivity

title: Andhra Pradesh prepares ground for translocation of two female tigers from Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh
content: The two tigers, one from Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve, will be introduced in PNP; Dy.CM K. Pawan Kalyan’s appeal for two female tigers was accepted.

title: Fishermen to protest proposed inclusion of Loop Road under expansion of Blue Flag Scheme
content: Many in Ayodhya Kuppam village are worried over the extension of the Blue Flag beach to more areas in the Marina and the loss of livelihoods due to removal of eateries and other shops

title: When a 16-day strike by transport employees and a bus accident on Deepavali shook Tamil Nadu in 2001
content: In November 2001, transport corporation employees’ unions struck work demanding the Tamil Nadu government to increase annual bonus to 20%. During the strike, 28 persons were killed in Thoothukudi district in an accident involving a TNSTC bus allegedly driven by a temporary casual labourer.

title: Ludhiana University's V-C removed over 'misbehaviour' with Kashmiri students
content: The private university has also initiated an internal probe into the matter, while the situation is being monitored by local authorities.

title: Radio-tagging reveals Olive Ridleys regularly return to nest on Chennai coast
content: Turtle named ‘Kayal’ came back to the same shore thrice in a single nesting season and laid a total of 389 eggs; another turtle ‘Megalai’ returned twice and laid 211 eggs; coastline under strict watch

title: Climate change posing serious challenges to Himachal Pradesh, says CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu
content: Terming these developments as warning signals and seeking urgent remedial measures, Mr. Sukhu asserted that any disturbance to the Himalayas would have the worst consequences not only for the State but for the entire nation.

title: Stones pelted, vehicles vandalised as Panipat refinery workers' protest turns violent
content: When the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel deployed at the refinery asked the protesters to remain in a designated area, some of them took exception to it and allegedly resorted to stone pelting.

title: Third long march in Maharashtra highlights forest rights act lapses
content: Meanwhile, the State government has called for a meeting at the Secretariat on Wednesday (February 25, 2026) to discuss the issues raised by the protestors.

title: Protest at AI summit: Four more Youth Congress members arrested
content: A total of eight Youth Congress members of the Congress’s youth wing have been arrested for their “shirts off” protest over the India-U.S. trade deal at the high-security event.

title: Government blocks 5 OTT platforms for streaming obscene content
content: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has blocked MoodXVIP, Koyal Playpro, Digi Movieplex, Feel, and Jugnu following due procedure

title: Kochi Corporation to issue bonds to mobilise resources for development
content: A high-power committee led by Corporation secretary to be constituted to coordinate activities related to municipal bond

title: Railway Board puts Vande Bharat Jammu-Srinagar extension on hold: Official
content: Earlier in the evening, Northern Railways had announced that the Vande Bharat Express would be extended up to Jammu Tawi from Katra, enabling direct connectivity between the twin capital cities of J&K from March 1

title: Amid DoT push, WhatsApp appears to test SIM-binding
content: DoT directions require the platform and other messaging apps to disable access if a SIM card is removed, and to log off users every six hours from companion access points like WhatsApp Web.

title: ‘Last-minute rush’ in filing forms for adding names in poll rolls raises questions
content: The final figure encompassed applications received before the process, which began on October 27, 2025, clarifies CEO Archana  Patnaik. It also covered about 5.73 lakh applications received online

title: The Hindu, VIT School of Law to host Justice Unplugged 2026
content: Will connect aspiring lawyers to judges, senior advocates, policymakers; focus on generative AI’s impact on legal practice, the evolution of fundamental rights in the digital age, improving access to justice

title: Vijayendra writes to Karnataka Chief Minister, seeking withdrawal of restrictions on media at Vidhana Soudha
content: BJP State president B.Y. Vijayendra has written to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah seeking withdrawal of a circular on restrictions on journalists at the Vidhana Soudha

title: DGCA grounds four aircraft of VSR Ventures, a month after Ajit Pawar’s death in crash
content: Aviation regulator to introduce safety ranking system for charter operators; directs them to disclose age of aircraft and and pilots’ experience on website

title: Sasikala launches political party, unveils flag
content: “The party would champion the cause of the poor and marginalised while eliminating both enemies and traitors,” Ms. Sasikala said

title: ABVP activists taken into preventive custody after vandalism at Azim Premji University
content: We strongly condemn the ruckus and violence that was unleashed on our campus by this external group of people, says the university

title: Supreme Court closes suo motu case on polluted rivers after five years of near inaction
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant questioned the feasibility of examining the extent of pollution in rivers across the country

title: Watch: Bihar Assembly erupts as Nitish Kumar hits back at RJD over ‘guns and bullets’ remark
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar lost his composure in the state assembly after opposition MLAs accused his government of ruling with “guns and bullets”.

title: Vellore Corporation to undertake biomining at landfill site near Palar river
content: Resident says the reclaimed land should be used for public purposes like children’s park and playground

title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 draft class will get picked in April.

title: Source: Kyler hasn't talked to Cards, refuting GM
content: Cardinals general manager Monti Ossenfort said he has spoken with quarterback Kyler Murray, but a source told ESPN that the two have not talked since the end of the season.

title: Boozer goes off as Duke beats Notre Dame by 44
content: Cameron Boozer had 24 points and 13 rebounds as No. 1 Duke beat Notre Dame 100-56 on Tuesday night, handing the Irish their worst home loss since 1898.

title: Sources: Aubrey pushes for bigger Cowboys offer
content: The Cowboys have extended an offer to Brandon Aubrey that would make him the highest-paid kicker in the NFL, sources told ESPN, but Aubrey's agent has asked for a deal closer to $10 million per season.

title: Hellebuyck set for Medal of Freedom, Trump says
content: Connor Hellebuyck, the goaltender for the gold-medal-winning U.S. men's Olympic hockey team, will be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, President Donald Trump announced during Tuesday night's State of the Union.

title: Lynch believes 49ers, Williams 'on the same page'
content: Shortly after ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Tuesday that left tackle Trent Williams and the 49ers are "struggling to find a contractual solution," general manager John Lynch offered a more optimistic perspective.

title: Botched final play sees Luka hesitate, LeBron miss
content: The Lakers lost to the Magic 110-109 on Tuesday after a botched sidelines out-of-bounds play between LeBron James and Luka Doncic in the final seconds failed to produce a quality shot.

title: Virginia QB Morris files lawsuit seeking 7th year
content: Virginia quarterback Chandler Morris has filed a lawsuit against the NCAA seeking a seventh year of eligibility.

title: Pirates' Griffin, MLB's top prospect, wows with HRs
content: Konnor Griffin, the Pirates' 19-year-old shortstop and the consensus No. 1 prospect in baseball, hit home runs off Red Sox pitchers Ranger Suarez and Seth Martinez.

title: 🔮 Predicting '28 Olympics U.S. men's hoops team
content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

title: Men's Bracketology: Duke's ascension to No. 1 overall was inevitable
content: It was only a matter of time until a path opened for the Blue Devils, who ride their win over Michigan to the top.

title: Women's Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: What's next for the NBA's 10 worst teams: Evaluating draft, free agency and trade options
content: Our NBA insiders break down the biggest questions for 10 lottery-bound teams after the trade deadline and ahead of the draft.

title: Champions League as it happened: Bodø/Glimt dump out last year's finalists Inter
content: Enjoy all that happened from today's UEFA Champions League matches, including Bodø/Glimt's historic win over Inter to advance to the round of 16.

title: Buster Olney ranks the top 10 shortstops in MLB this season
content: Olney's ranking of the top players at every position continues with the premier infield position: shortstop. Find out who comes out on top of this star-studded field.

title: Key factors that could define the men's NCAA tournament selection process
content: From metrics to star injuries and Charles Bediako, the key discussion points that could define March Madness.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Auburn slides in SEC pecking order
content: The Tigers have lost six of seven games to fall into the ninth position of a projected 10- to 11-bid conference.

title: 'The time is now': Inside the Peterson availability saga at Kansas
content: The projected No. 1 NBA draft pick has sat out enough games to cast uncertainty on his team's potential in March.

title: 'Oh god! Who built this?': The origin of the WWE Elimination Chamber
content: At the 2002 Survivor Series, six WWE superstars entered the Elimination Chamber. We look back at that night.

title: What to know about Floyd Mayweather-Manny Pacquiao rematch
content: Andreas Hale answers questions about the rematch and explains how the matchup looks 11 years after their first encounter.

title: NFL free agency tiers: Barnwell ranks the best QBs, RBs, WRs, TEs and OL
content: NFL free agency is almost here, and we placed players on offense into tiers based on their potential offseason contracts. Who could get paid?

title: They're back! Key returning players for every top 25 team
content: With all the focus on the portal, we look at the most important players retained across college football.

title: Premier League summer transfers: A bunch of busts, or just proof patience is needed?
content: The slew of high-priced players who joined the Premier League in the summer transfer window haven't exactly been on fire. Why the slow starts?

title: Back at the Bernabéu: Could Mourinho return to coach Real Madrid again?
content: Wednesday's clash isn't just a chance for José Mourinho's Benfica to eliminate Real Madrid from the Champions League. It might also be an audition.

title: MLS Power Rankings: LAFC lead the way after win over champs Miami and Lionel Messi
content: LAFC get a convincing win over defending champions Inter Miami to kick off the 2026 MLS season and the latest ESPN Power Rankings.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Ryan Garcia enters welterweight top five
content: A masterful title fight performance from Garcia earns him a WBC belt and a spot among the welterweight elite.

title: 'Got to be careful around Mario': Kirby Smart, Mario Cristobal trade joking barbs at Steve Spurrier Awards
content: At the 2026 Steve Spurrier Awards dinner -- named for a coach known for his wit -- Mario Cristobal and Kirby Smart fittingly traded jokes on Monday night.

title: As NIL cash grows, coaches call for rules to protect athletes from 'street agents'
content: Coaches and other observers see a growing need to protect athletes by regulating middlemen in NIL deals.

title: Dreams on paper, gold on ice: Revisiting Jack Hughes' and Alysa Liu's 2019 letters
content: In 2019, Hughes and Liu wrote to their retired selves. In 2026, they added Olympic gold to the story.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Pickups: Pick up Melton, Wallace and Raynaud for the homestretch
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Pickups: Why Dostal, Laferriere are post-Olympics must-adds
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: Luxury Car Maker Aston Martin To Cut 20% Of Staff After Trump Tariffs
content: British luxury carmaker Aston Martin on Wednesday announced plans to cut up to one-fifth of its workforce after widening annual losses on US tariffs and weak Chinese demand.

title: Housekeeping Staff Pose As "GST Officers", Scam Bengaluru Traders
content: Two housekeeping employees, working at a Central Government GST office, posed as "Intelligence Officers" and ran an extortion racket targeting city traders before being caught in Bengaluru.

title: Who Is A Designated Survivor And Why Does US Need One?
content: A cabinet official was notably absent and stayed under a special security arrangement as Donald Trump delivered his State of the Union speech today.

title: Chevron Sells Venezuelan Oil To Reliance For The 1st Time Since 2023: Report
content: US oil major Chevron has sold its first cargo of Venezuelan crude oil to Reliance Industries since December 2023, according to ship tracking data and two sources.

title: Video: Dog Carries Human Leg, Shimla Hospital Says Staff Forgot To Lock Door
content: Investigation into the shocking video of a stray dog walking around with a human leg between its jaws near a hospital in Shimla has revealed gross negligence in disposing of medical waste

title: "Shocking": Minister On BSNL Director's 'Underwear, Hair Oil' Task For Officials
content: As per an official order, around 20 tasks were assigned to nearly 50 officials for BSNL Director Vivek Banzal's two day visit to Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj.

title: Give AI Access To Military Or Lose Contract: US' Warning To Anthropic CEO
content: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth gave Anthropic's CEO a Friday deadline to open the company's AI technology for unrestricted military use or risk losing its government contract, according to a person familiar with their meeting.

title: Trump's "Somali Pirates" Jab At Ilhan Omar Triggers Heated Exchange
content: Democratic Representative Ilhan Omar took on Donald Trump during his State of the Union address, calling him a "liar" after the US President claimed that Somali pirates had "ransacked Minnesota".

title: Head Of France's Palace Of Versailles To Take Over Louvre: Report
content: The president of France's Palace of Versailles is expected to take over as head of the Louvre following the resignation of Laurence des Cars, an informed source told AFP on Wednesday.

title: Delhi To Be Renamed Indraprastha? BJP MP Writes To Centre
content: In a recent development, after the state officially adopted the name Kerala as "Keralam" in official usage, a BJP MP from Delhi has now urged the Centre to consider renaming the national capital as "Indraprastha".

title: US Judge Dismisses xAI Trade-Secrets Lawsuit Against Rival OpenAI For Now
content: A federal judge in California on Tuesday dismissed a lawsuit from Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI that accused rival Sam Altman's OpenAI of stealing its trade secrets.

title: Afghan And Pakistani Forces Trade Fire At Border
content: Afghan and Pakistani forces traded fire at their border on Tuesday, officials on both sides said, while blaming each other for the outbreak of violence.

title: On Camera, Bride Shot In Stomach On Wedding Stage In Bihar
content: A wedding ceremony in Bihar's Buxar turned into mourning on Tuesday night after the bride was shot allegedly by her lover. The man has been identified as Deenbandhu, a neighbour.

title: 'Breakups Are Common': Court Gives Bail To Man In Ex-Lover's Suicide Case
content: The Delhi High Court has granted regular bail to a man in a case alleging abetment of suicide, observing that a broken relationship by itself does not constitute instigation under criminal law.

title: "We Fail To Understand": Top Court Rejects Petition Against "Yadav Ji Ki Love story"
content: Underscoring that the title of the movie "Yadav Ji Ki Love Story" nowhere has any word that portrays the Yadav community in a negative light, the Supreme Court on Wednesday dismissed the petition seeking a stay on the film's release.

title: Trump's 'Dalilah Law' Demand After Girl Injured In Crash By Indian Driver
content: US President Donald Trump called on the American Congress to pass the 'Delilah Law', which would bar illegal immigrants from receiving commercial driver's licences.

title: No Black Box In Air Ambulance That Crashed In Jharkhand. What Rules Say
content: Five of a family and two crew members were killed after an air ambulance en route to Delhi crashed in Jharkhand's Chatra.

title: "Won't Allow Anyone To Defame Institution": Supreme Court On NCERT Row
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday expressed "grave concern" over the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) Class 8 textbook chapter on "corruption" in the judiciary.

title: "Did Nothing Illicit": Bill Gates On Sex With Russian Girls Claim In Epstein Files
content: Bill Gates told staff that he began meeting Epstein in 2011 and was aware of his legal trouble that restricted his travel, but admitted that he did not conduct a thorough background check at the time.
